Package config

Class ServerConfig

java.lang.Object
config.ServerConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
LogProducer, SharedBuffer
public class ServerConfig extends Object implements LogProducer
Handles loading and accessing server settings from the config file.

This class is responsible for retrieving server parameters such as port, document root, default pages, logging preferences, maximum concurrent requests, and cache expiration time. It implements LogProducer to allow logging configuration-related issues.

  • Constructor Details

    • ServerConfig

      public ServerConfig(String filePath)
      Constructs a ServerConfig and loads configuration from the given file path. Logs an error if the file cannot be loaded.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the server configuration file

  • Method Details

    • getRoot

      public String getRoot()
      Returns the root directory where the server is located (working directory + server.root). If the configuration is missing, defaults to "".
      Returns:
      absolute path to the server root directory

    • getPort

      public int getPort()
      Returns the port number the server should listen on. If the configuration is invalid, missing or corrupt, defaults to 8080.
      Returns:
      the configured port number

    • getDefaultPageFile

      public String getDefaultPageFile()
      Returns the default file name to serve when a directory is requested. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "index".
      Returns:
      the name of the default page file

    • getDefaultPageExtension

      public String getDefaultPageExtension()
      Returns the default file extension for pages. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "html".
      Returns:
      the file extension for default pages

    • getDocumentRoot

      public String getDocumentRoot()
      Returns the document root directory from which content should be served. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "/server/html".
      Returns:
      the absolute path to the document root

    • getPage404

      public String getPage404()
      Returns the relative path to the custom 404 error page. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "404.html".
      Returns:
      the configured 404 error page path

    • getMaxRequests

      public int getMaxRequests()
      Returns the maximum number of concurrent requests the server should handle. If the configuration is invalid or missing, defaults to 5.
      Returns:
      the maximum number of requests

    • getLogPath

      public String getLogPath()
      Returns the directory where server logs should be stored. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "/logs".
      Returns:
      the path to the log directory

    • getLogFileName

      public String getLogFileName()
      Returns the name of the log file where request logs will be written. If the configuration is missing, defaults to "loggingLogsLotsOfLogs".
      Returns:
      the name of the log file

    • getCacheExpirationTime

      public Duration getCacheExpirationTime()
      Returns the configured cache expiration duration. If the configuration is invalid or missing, defaults to 30 seconds.
      Returns:
      the cache expiration time as a Duration
